intro: Brassica oleracea var. communis, commonly known as broccoli, is a cultivar of the cabbage family (Brassicaceae) characterized by its dense, green flower heads and thick, edible stalks. It is a biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 40–90 cm, with a robust root system and alternate, palmately lobed leaves. The plant thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Broccoli is a member of the Brassica genus, which includes other vegetables like cauliflower, cabbage, and kale. Its botanical features make it a versatile and nutritious crop widely cultivated around the world.
